column4: Hey guys. Just want some help about my monitor. I just switched monitors and the right resolutions aren't showing up. I already ran sudo nvidia-xconfig and configured xorg.conf but the correct resolutions still aren't showing up in nVidia X-Server Settings. Anyone who can help me?
gksudo nvidia-settings dosent show the proper res's ?
if it helps here's my xorg.conf: http://pastebin.com/f7b4dc07e
xorg.conf modes not showing up in nvidia settings.
nvidia settings tool probes the monitors i think it dosent use the ones from xorg.conf
you could try removing xorg.conf (rename it) and rerun nvidia-settings tool to let it remake it
the nvidia-xconfig tool is a little old ane may be making a bad config

I was the one who was having monitor resolutions problems earlier. You told me to rename xorg.conf and run nvidia-settings. I did as you told me but the correct resolutions are still aren't showing up. I rebooted my pc and saw the nVidia driver was deactivated so I reinstalled and the right resolutions are still not there.
the drivers are activated now?  if they keep getting deactivated on reboot.. thats going to be aproblem
yeah I activated after I rebooted my pc. What should I do?
not sure. I rarely have any issuesd with my 3 mvidia machines.
if you activate after reboot.. you need to restart X or perhaps reboot.
Yeah, I already rebooted after reactivating it. I'm using GEForce2 MX/Mx 400.
thats an old card aint it. :(
i recall in ages past a lot of issues with 'MX' cards
Yeah, it is. :( But I used to use to this monitor in the same CPU but this is the first time I've encountered this problem.
